intro: Euphrasia platyphylla, commonly known as the broad-leaved eyebright, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and oval-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and rocky areas. It produces numerous tiny, clustered flowers that bloom in early spring. Euphrasia platyphylla is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
